result.execSummary:
The defendant Janice F Amos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Any remaining fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016 or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Janice F Amos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Janice F Amos in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.  
FINE:  $631.00  Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Money due and owing to be paid at a rate of $50.00 a month commencing 4/1/2016, failure to pay will result in 5 days huber.
Sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 02:00 pm
to be brought before branch 3 only for sentencing.

Case called at 10:47 am for a sentencing hearing.  Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Janice F Amos did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court revokes bail.  Court issues a capias, body only to be brought before Branch 3. Defendant appeared at 1:42 pm.  Court quashes capias.  Attorney Bricco is out sick for the remainder of the day.  Court shedules another hearing.
Sentencing hearing at 02-08-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Janice F Amos in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Sentencing hearing scheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
